how_it_works.title: How It Works
how_it_works.step1_description: Make sure your Notion page is already publicly shared. Copy the link and paste it into our system.
how_it_works.step2_description: Choose a password that will be required for anyone trying to access your page.
how_it_works.step3_description: You'll receive a link like notionlock.com/p/abc123. Only those with the password can view your Notion page.

accessibility.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility.description: Our commitment to ensuring NotionLock is accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities.
accessibility.commitment_text: We believe that the web should be available and accessible to anyone, regardless of circumstance and ability. To fulfill this, we aim to adhere as strictly as possible to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 at the AA level, which defines guidelines for improving accessibility for people with disabilities.
accessibility.measures_text: We have taken the following measures to ensure accessibility:
accessibility.measure_1: The site's structure is semantic and logical, making it easier for screen readers to navigate.
accessibility.measure_2: We ensure that all interactive elements are accessible via keyboard.
accessibility.measure_3: Text alternatives are provided for non-text content.
accessibility.measure_4: Our design maintains a sufficient color contrast between text and backgrounds.
accessibility.measure_5: The site is responsive and usable on different screen sizes.
accessibility.feedback_text: We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of NotionLock. If you encounter any barriers or have suggestions, please let us know. You can contact us through the channels provided on our 'About Us' page.
accessibility.last_updated: This statement was last updated on June 30, 2025.
